title: 2 teens arrested, 1 charged with murder for killing another teen
content:
Two suspects have been arrested in connection to a robbery and murder that took place on Sunday morning at the Exxon Service Station located at 2272 St. Stephens Road.
Mobile police arrested Fabian Russell, 17, and Christopher Logan, 18, in the incident.
Police said at approximately 2:08 a.m. officers responded to gas station for a report of one person shot. When officers arrived they located 17-year-old Jacob Thomas in the parking lot suffering from an apparent gunshot wound.
Mobile Fire Rescue responded and pronounced Thomas deceased on the scene.
Through an investigation detectives located, interviewed and later charged Russell with first degree robbery. During a perp walk Logan repeatedly told reporters he fired his gun in self defense.
Logan was charged with murder and first degree robbery in the incident.
